content.content: Treasury Diversification Working Group Update - 3/5/2022 Update from Last Week  Reached out to more DAOs, VCs, and other potential candidates to have them fill out our interest form. Set up a recurring weekly call for the working group to discuss any updates on the process Began having calls with interested strategic partners  Plan for This Week  Process any new form submissions Continue to have initial calls with partners Continue to finalize terms of the partnership (e.g. vesting schedule, etc.) Share any conflicts of interest (as defined in our Ethics Policy in forum post 2).  Asks from the Community Our focus is still on reaching out to potential strategic partners to have initial conversations. With that in mind, if you’d like to recommend a candidate strategic partner, please leave a comment on the second forum post or contact a member of the working group. If you have other questions or feedback, please feel free to leave a comment on this thread! References   2/26/2022 Update   2/19/2022 Update   2/14/2022 Update   2/5/2022 Update   Gitcoin Treasury Diversification   Treasury Diversification Part II - Welcoming Strategic Partners

content.content: Treasury Diversification Working Group Update - 2/5/2022 Hi all, sharing an update from the working group. Update from Last Week  Drafted our latest forum post welcoming strategic partners to participate in the treasury diversification. Incorporated feedback from our first treasury diversification forum post. Made a list of specific value-adds that partners should provide to Gitcoin, incorporating Gitcoin’s main strategic goals. Shared Treasury Diversification Part II - Welcoming Strategic Partners on the forum. Made a form for potential strategic partners (linked in the forum post). Started tracking working group hours.  Plan for This Week This week, our focus will be on taking in interest from strategic partners.  Draft a detailed plan for how we’ll reach out to and speak with candidate partners (how & where we’ll speak with them, how/where/when we’ll have them speak to the community, etc.). Reach out to potential candidates and have them fill out our interest form. Respond to community feedback here and on our second forum post. Integrate that feedback in our process where relevant. Share any conflicts of interest (as defined in our Ethics Policy in forum post 2).  Asks from the Community We encourage community members to share their feedback on the second forum post and suggest any other criteria they feel is relevant. References  Gitcoin Treasury Diversification Treasury Diversification Part II - Welcoming Strategic Partners
content.GPT-summary: The post is an update from the Treasury Diversification Working Group, explaining their progress and plans for the future. They have drafted a forum post welcoming strategic partners to participate in the treasury diversification and made a list of specific value-adds that partners should provide to Gitcoin. The group's focus for the upcoming week is to take in interest from strategic partners and draft a detailed plan for how they will reach out to and speak with candidate partners. The community is encouraged to share their feedback and suggest any other relevant criteria.

content.content: Treasury Diversification Working Group Update - 2/14/2022 Hi all, sharing an update from the working group. Apologies for the delay - from now on, we’ll share these updates on Saturdays. Update from Last Week This week, our focus was on preparing to have conversations with strategic partners.  Formed plan for how we’ll reach out to and speak with candidate partners (how & where we’ll speak with them, how/where/when we’ll have them speak to the community, etc.). More details to come, but we plan on having initial calls with partners and the working group and a larger Q&A session with the community. Formed list of 40+ potential partners. Reached out to potential candidates and have them fill out our interest form. Updated our interest form to make it easier for partners to use.  Plan for This Week  Ramp up our outbound requests potential candidates and have them fill out our interest form. Share any conflicts of interest (as defined in our Ethics Policy in forum post 2 ). Draft thoughts on terms of the partnership (e.g. vesting schedule, etc.) Begin having initial calls with partners  Asks from the Community If you’d like to recommend a candidate strategic partner, please leave a comment on the second forum post or contact a member of the working group. If you have other questions or feedback, please feel free to leave a comment on this thread! References  2/5/2022  Update Gitcoin Treasury Diversification  Treasury Diversification Part II - Welcoming Strategic Partners
content.GPT-summary: The post is an update from the Treasury Diversification Working Group, explaining their focus on preparing to have conversations with strategic partners. They have formed a plan for how they will reach out to and speak with candidate partners, and have formed a list of 40+ potential partners. The post also includes asks from the community for recommendations of candidate strategic partners and feedback.

content.content: I am excited to help as much as I can here and appreciate the work thats been happening.

Treasury Diversification Working Group Update - 2/26/2022 Update from Last Week Last week, we continued gauging interest from potential strategic partners.  Continued reaching out to DAOs, VCs, and other potential candidates to have them fill out our interest form. Answered any initial questions asynchronously and prepared to have first conversations in the next week. Discussed different ways of structuring the diversification (how many partners are optimal & distribution of partner commitment size). Discussed potential terms for the diversification.  Plan for This Week  Process any additional form submissions Have initial calls with partners Share any conflicts of interest (as defined in our Ethics Policy in forum post 2 ).  Asks from the Community If you’d like to recommend a candidate strategic partner, please leave a comment on the second forum post or contact a member of the working group. If you have other questions or feedback, please feel free to leave a comment on this thread! References  2/19/2022 Update 2/14/2022 Update  2/5/2022 Update  Gitcoin Treasury Diversification  Treasury Diversification Part II - Welcoming Strategic Partners

Continued our weekly working group call to sync on updates and discuss terms and partnership structure. Explored various pricing options for the diversification. Continued initial calls with interested strategic partners.  Plan for This Week  Process any new form submissions. Continue to have initial calls and follow up calls with partners. Discuss any updates in our weekly meeting. Share any conflicts of interest (as defined in our Ethics Policy in forum post 2).  Asks from the Community If you’d like to recommend a candidate strategic partner, please leave a comment on the second forum post or contact a member of the working group. If you have other questions or feedback, please feel free to leave a comment on this thread! content.content: Would love more details, or a tl;dr if they have one

Thanks @Lunacat! We haven’t explored using LaaS for this diversification as we’re focused on finding the right long term strategic partners for Gitcoin DAO, which we feel can be best accomplished through the WG. Echoing Kyle, it’d be great to hear more about what you’re thinking. Could you elaborate on how you see LaaS fitting into our goals here? GTC trades about $20m of volume daily so liquidity hasn’t been a huge concern.
